passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Edwin Hubble was an American astronomer who made groundbreaking discoveries in the field of extragalactic astronomy. • Hubble's observations led to the realization that the universe is expanding. • His work on the classification of galaxies laid the foundation for modern astrophysics. • The Hubble Space Telescope, launched in 1990, was named in his honor.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to highlight Edwin Hubble's most significant contribution to the field of astrophysics?

choices.A: Edwin Hubble, an American astronomer, had a space telescope named after him.
choices.B: Hubble's work in extragalactic astronomy led to the creation of the Hubble Space Telescope.
choices.C: Edwin Hubble's groundbreaking discovery of the expanding universe revolutionized our understanding of astrophysics.
choices.D: Hubble's classification of galaxies laid the groundwork for the development of the Hubble Space Telescope.

explanation: C: 'Edwin Hubble's groundbreaking discovery of the expanding universe revolutionized our understanding of astrophysics.' is the correct answer because it highlights his most significant contribution to the field.
distractor_explanation: 'Edwin Hubble, an American astronomer, had a space telescope named after him.' is incorrect because it only mentions the naming of the telescope and does not highlight his significant contributions.
'Hubble's work in extragalactic astronomy led to the creation of the Hubble Space Telescope.' is incorrect because it focuses on the telescope rather than his groundbreaking discovery.

'Hubble's classification of galaxies laid the groundwork for the development of the Hubble Space Telescope.' is incorrect because it emphasizes the classification of galaxies instead of his most significant contribution, the discovery of the expanding universe.
